meanings.definition: A person or thing that upheaves or lifts up.
meanings.sent1: The strong man was the upheaver of heavy boxes in the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The crane acted as the upheaver, lifting the cargo onto the ship.
meanings.sent3: The little dog thought he was an upheaver when he tried to lift the big bone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was an upheaver of spirits, lifting everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was known as the ultimate upheaver, always lifting people out of danger.

meanings.definition: To lift up or raise with great effort or force.
meanings.sent1: She had to upheaver the heavy rock to reveal the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: The workers had to upheaver the fallen tree blocking the road.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to upheaver the massive pot of soup onto the stove.
meanings.sent4: His words upheavered her spirits, giving her the strength to carry on.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays upheavered the fog, revealing a stunning view of the valley.
